question.body: What problem(s) is/are associated with glucose homeostasis dysfunction?

response.feedback: This is only partly correct. Eyesight and other body functions can also be severely impacted by glucose homeostasis dysfunction.

part.hint: Diabetes is associated with glucose homeostasis dysfunction.

question.body: What system of the body is important in the regulating of molecules and macromolecules in the body as a receptor and control center?

response.feedback: Correct. Other things can also regulate molecules and macromolecules, including the nervous system, but many times the endocrine system serves as receptor and regulator.
Incorrect. Often the digestive system is involved in homeostasis feedback loops as an effector to adjust absorption, but not as a receptor and control center.
Incorrect. Often the urinary system is involved in homeostasis feedback loops as a way to get rid of excess molecules and macromolecules, but not usually as a receptor or control center.
Incorrect. The skeletal system is involved in calcium homeostasis, but not as a receptor or control center.
